name: Amsterdam
fun_fact: Fun fact: Amsterdam has more bicycles (881,000) than people (872,000), and more canals than Venice! The city is built on wooden poles driven into marshy ground - the Royal Palace alone sits on 13,659 wooden piles.

hero_dishes.name: Bitterballen
hero_dishes.description: Crispy deep-fried meatballs with creamy ragout inside, served with mustard
hero_dishes.origin_story: The quintessential Dutch bar snack - served everywhere from brown caf√©s to Michelin restaurants
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Caf√© 't Smalle, De Drie Graefjes, any brown caf√© (bruine kroeg)

hero_dishes.name: Stroopwafel
hero_dishes.description: Two thin waffle layers with caramel syrup filling - best fresh from the market
hero_dishes.origin_story: Invented in Gouda in the late 1700s by a baker using leftover breadcrumbs - now the Dutch national cookie
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Albert Cuyp Market (fresh), Lanskroon bakery, anywhere fresh-pressed

hero_dishes.name: Haring (Dutch Herring)
hero_dishes.description: Raw herring eaten with onions and pickles, head tilted back
hero_dishes.origin_story: The Dutch Golden Age was built on herring trade - 'Hollandse Nieuwe' is the first catch of the season in June
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Frens Haringhandel, Stubbe's Haring, any haringkar (herring cart)

hero_dishes.name: Stamppot
hero_dishes.description: Mashed potatoes with vegetables (kale, sauerkraut, carrots) and smoked sausage
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Dutch winter comfort food - stamppot boerenkool (with kale) is the classic
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Moeders, D'Vijff Vlieghen, traditional Dutch restaurants

signature_drinks.name: Jenever
signature_drinks.description: Dutch gin, the original precursor to English gin - malty and smooth
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At a proeflokaal (tasting house), sipped from a tulip glass filled to the brim - lean down to sip!

signature_drinks.name: Heineken/Amstel
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: In brown caf√©s (bruine kroegen) - a 'vaasje' is a small draft beer

food_culture_notes: Albert Cuyp Market is the largest street market for local food
Brown caf√©s (bruine kroegen) are cozy traditional pubs with dark wood interiors
Foodhallen in De Hallen has excellent international street food
Indonesian food is huge due to colonial history - rijsttafel is essential
